page.title: 07PEDESTRIANS IN LIVINGSTON
page.content: Our new town is designed with the safety of the pedestrian specifically in mind. The town roads branch in a free flow system from the main spine which bisects the town and they then form a grid system. The roads curve in order to discourage through traffic and also to keep speed down. The pedestrian footpaths linking all areas of the town are entirely separate from vehicular traffic routes. Underpasses and footbridges are provided where roads have to be crossed. Bus stops are situated where pedestrian paths meet the roads. We can walk freely everywhere without worry. Most of our streets are cul-de-sacs which discourage traffic even more. As we are unused to crossing roads we have to be careful in older towns. Traffic lights and Green men are alien to us!
